item.title: Github - Command Line Interface Procedures
item.description: Summary This article documents the most common ways I interact with git and in maintaining my programs. graph LR; subgraph High-Level Process direction LR 0[Installation]-->1[SSH] 1 --> 2[Git Configuration] 2 --> 3[New Repository] 3 --> 4[Commit Changes] end Why should I use Git with the Command Line? Git was designed as a command-line tool, therefore it’s considered the de-facto way to interact with Git’s tools. Any other versions of Git are just wrappers for what Git does on the command-line.
